title: Making movies, like making sausages, is not pretty. Just ask John Sayles.
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: John Sayles, an Oscar-nominated director, is promoting his new novel 'Crucible' set in Detroit during Henry Ford's era.
Sayles has a history of adapting stories into films, often struggling with budget constraints in the current movie industry.
He is scheduled for book events in Massachusetts, including Cambridge and Newburyport, discussing story adaptation processes.

title: Can you find your partner on a stoop in Southie? The creator of Boston’s ‘Stoop Dating’ thinks so.
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Stoop Dating, created by Julz Radley, is a Boston-based social media dating show featuring blind dates on a South Boston stoop.
The show pairs singles for hour-long dates, combining interviews with casual conversations to assess chemistry.
Stoop Dating has gained over 30,000 Instagram followers and 44,300 TikTok followers, and Radley hopes to foster face-to-face interactions.

title: 2 charged in Brockton killing after months as fugitives, DA says
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Micheal Thompson, 35, and Dayana Slade, 25, charged after being fugitives for months in Mike Jonas's murder in Brockton.
Thompson faces first degree murder charge; Slade charged as accessory after the fact, held on $250,000 bail.
Thompson identified as shooter in Finnegan Park incident; surveillance showed him leaving with Slade in an SUV.

title: Red Sox reportedly tried to trade for standout shortstop this offseason
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Red Sox attempted to trade for Angels shortstop Zach Neto, known for consecutive 20-20 seasons.
Angels set high trade requirements for Neto, resulting in no agreement with the Red Sox.
Red Sox acquired Caleb Durbin from Brewers, enhancing infield flexibility, despite failed Neto trade.

title: Former driving school owner gets 1 day in jail for RMV bribery scheme
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Carlos Cardoso, 72, sentenced to 1 day in jail for RMV bribery scheme in Brockton, is fined $5,500.
Cardoso participated in scheme from 2019 to 2021, bribing RMV examiners $20,000 for up to 300 licenses.
Sentence mitigated due to Cardoso's health problems post-assault; involved issuing 2,100 false test passes.

title: Stefon Diggs and Cardi B may have broken up following Patriots Super Bowl loss
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Stefon Diggs and Cardi B may have broken up after unfollowing each other on Instagram post-Super Bowl.
The New England Patriots lost to the Seattle Seahawks 29-13 in Super Bowl LX.
Diggs faced charges of felony strangulation and misdemeanor assault, with an arraignment set for February 13.

title: An emotional Alex Cora explains why Bad Bunny’s Super Bowl performance meant so much to him
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Alex Cora praised Bad Bunny's all-Spanish Super Bowl Halftime Show performance, calling it culturally significant and true to Puerto Rican roots.
Cora found Bad Bunny's portrayal of Puerto Rican culture authentic, highlighting elements like street coconut stands and a beauty parlor.
Despite criticism, Bad Bunny received support from NFL commissioner Goodell, who called him a unifying artist following his performance.

title: Watch: Providence releases body cam footage of Brown University shooting response
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Providence released 20 minutes of body cam footage of police response to Brown University shooting, where two were killed.
The footage shows officers clearing floors, locating students, and searching for the suspect at the incident site.
Shooter Claudio Neves Valente also killed an MIT professor before dying in a New Hampshire storage unit from suicide.

title: Former Patriots lineman Keion White undergoes surgery after being shot in ankle in San Francisco
author: The Associated Press
bullets: Keion White, a San Francisco 49ers lineman, was shot in the ankle and underwent surgery early Monday in San Francisco.
San Francisco police report the shooting occurred after a verbal altercation between two groups; no arrests have been made.
White joined the 49ers mid-season from the Patriots; this is the second 49ers player shooting incident in 18 months.

title: Jayson Tatum to practice with Maine Celtics as he nears potential return
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jayson Tatum assigned to the Maine Celtics for practice as he nears return after Achilles injury.
Tatum has been participating in 5-on-5 scrimmages and is expected to continue rehab in Boston.
Celtics currently tied with the Knicks for second in the East with a record of 34-19.
